meanings.definition: A skilled worker who has completed an apprenticeship and is fully trained in a trade or craft.
meanings.sent1: The journeyman crafted a beautiful wooden table with intricate designs.
meanings.sent2: The journeyman plumber fixed the leak in the kitchen sink efficiently.
meanings.sent3: The journeyman joked that he could build a house blindfolded, but no one believed him.
meanings.sent4: In the world of woodworking, he was a journeyman, creating masterpieces with every stroke.
meanings.sent5: The journeyman's expertise in carpentry was evident in the flawless finish of the bookshelf.

meanings.definition: A competent but undistinguished worker or performer.
meanings.sent1: The journeyman singer delivered a solid performance at the local talent show.
meanings.sent2: As a journeyman chef, he could whip up a delicious meal in no time.
meanings.sent3: The journeyman actor always played background roles, but his presence was memorable.
meanings.sent4: She was a journeyman in the art of baking, creating treats that delighted all who tasted them.
meanings.sent5: The journeyman painter may not be famous, but his work speaks volumes about his talent.

meanings.definition: A person who has served an apprenticeship and is employed by a master craftsman.
meanings.sent1: The journeyman blacksmith learned the trade under the guidance of a skilled mentor.
meanings.sent2: In the workshop, the journeyman worked diligently under the watchful eye of the master.
meanings.sent3: The journeyman joked that his hammer was his best friend, always by his side.
meanings.sent4: To the master craftsman, the journeyman was like a reflection of his own early days.
meanings.sent5: The journeyman's dedication to his craft earned him respect among his peers.
